website_summaries.verdict: One of the best studio headphones available on the market today.
pros: A great combination of sound isolation mixed with more presence and volume in the overall sound quality
cons: Doesn't fare well as a set of mixing headphones for professional musicians and technicians

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price premium over the original K240s
customer_reviews.text: A bit of an upgrade from the K240, but I didn't like the velor ear pads at all, though the standard ones are nicer than the stock K240s. The straight cable that came with it had a short out of the box. Definitely not worth the price premium, stick with the regular K240s and maybe buy some upgrades for them. Sound is of course the same on both versions
customer_reviews.author: jordan earls

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: They are open back, so no noise canceling by design. They were great while they worked. Used them very lightly, for about an hour every week. Barely six month into it and left channel quit working, I made sure it wasn't the cable or adapter, nope - it's the headphones. I had a different brand last over 10 year with my light use of them. With this type of quality control I might as well go with Chinese cheap stuff and buy new ones every half a year for a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hlywine

customer_reviews.title: Not like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: The 240 is a classic... not in this incarnation though, sadly. They are hard, stiff, and uncomfortable; everything the originals were not. I don't like to gauge products by the price, but these feel like something that costs $30 tops. If you mush them against your ears the sound is kind of there, but they're effectively Chinese clones of the original. I should have guessed so, since the price is about half of what they were 20 years ago (not even considering inflation). Also they were shipped in the factory box, no external packaging. I can only hope that I've finally been a victim of an Amazon phony and that I will get my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Noname Norelation

customer_reviews.title: Great quality headphones! Makes you want to hear more music
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound quality - hands down the best headphones that I have used. Clear sound. I use it for listening to music on my phone. Bass is a bit low - but that should be by design as this is a studio monitor headphone. One can use an app on the phone to increase bass (iphone users - sorry - I dont think there is an app that will do this universally like android). Definitely not for bass heads - but a amazing quality headphones for the price. Each time I hear a familiar song, I am able to notice some hidden instrument/note that I have not heard earlier - using other headphones or using a home theater setup.
customer_reviews.author: subbu

customer_reviews.title: Please wrap package in unidentifiable packaging
customer_reviews.text: So these headphones are amazing they're industry standard headphones. But what I dont get is why would the company leave the product in clear plastic? This item cost more than 50 dollars and should not be identifiable. Please wrap the contents appropriately other than that the sound is amazing and clear. I wanted to listen to eveything with these headphones which I decided not to do.
customer_reviews.author: Karbear

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones from a respected company.
customer_reviews.text: At the current price that Amazon is offering on these headphones, I consider them the best value on the market. These are balanced and clean sounding without overdone highs and muddy that mar the popular brand. I use them for both listening to music and playing instruments. The inclusion of two cables, one straight and one coiled, is great for musicians. I always use a straight cable when playing keyboard because I want the cable to hand down away from my arms. For listening to music I like the coiled cable so I can move around without getting tangled. If anyone asks me to recommend a set of headphones under $300 this is usually my starting point.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, pinches ears alot
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, but man does it pinch my ears. I have tried lots of different positions but after about an hour of use I have to either shift them again or remove them completely. Sits firm on the head, connections are great, feels sturdy and looks great... but it pinches my ears. From top of my ear(s) to bottom its 3 inches so smaller ears may be fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: THE GIFT OF THE AUDIOPHILE GODS
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are the best headphones ever. The only thing that can make them sound better is your actual music quality and the quality of your ears lol. None of the frequencies are boosted, these are monitors which will not manipulate or boost any parts of the audio. I purchased a Fiio E6 to use with this and they pair up quite nicely:  Do not buy these if you are using them outside of quiet rooms, I would look at the new Audio Technica ATH-M40x for use in louder areas or for commute:  Overall perfect headphones, the only things that sound better are over $400.
customer_reviews.author: Kush Patel

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are so comfortable! I can have them on for 1
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are so comfortable! I can have them on for 1.5 hours without having issues. I really like how the EQ is flat, so there is no bass emphasis or other things, allowing me to do live mixing, do studio mixing, play computer games, or play music without having to deal with inflated sounds. I find the coiled cord works better for me than the straight cord, so I'm glad they included both.
customer_reviews.author: mts

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile but I do have to wear headphones most of the day for work. I have been through countless in-ear, over the head, small, and large headphones and these are by far the most comfortable and best sounding by a long shot. I was a bit nervous about getting open back headphones but the sound is amazing and I can still hear if someone knocks on the door. These are truly the best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G

customer_reviews.title: The Best Headphones for Layperson AND the Audiophile
customer_reviews.text: I've been using AKG headphones for longer than I can remember, and nothing comes to close the quality or bang for the buck as the K 240 MK II or K240 Studio version. Until recently I had used the K240 Studio version and absolutely love them. The MK II version is the same sound quality from everything I can tell, but the ear cushions are much more comfortable. I'm telling you for both audio enjoyment and for mixing purposes, both the lay person and the professional will LOVE these headphones. If you've been using crappy headphones and make the move to these, you're mind will be blown.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Oelke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional voice over artist and this headset came highly recommended to me by an audio coach. Glad I took his recommendation. This head set is extremely comfortable with excellent sound quality. They are very lightweight with comfort ear pads that don't put too much pressure on your ears. The wide head band is completely adjustable and very lightweight as well. It comes with 2 audio cords - one coiled and one straight.
customer_reviews.author: Artist Gigi

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, it's comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I only play games and listen to music. These seem more suited for sound mixers and the like, but they satisfy my needs just fine. The sound is, as expected, all-around stellar. These were a lot more comfortable than the last pair I had, which made my ears hot and my temples sore. This pair of AKG headphones does not feel that way, and I am VERY grateful for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Feeves

customer_reviews.title: Unchange in 40 years and still great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Back in the early 70's I owned several large Audio Stores and we sold the AKG 240 as ours top of the line phones..Well over the years mine became beat up and misplace. Ordered the 240 mkII here on ebay and they arrived today. Same great sound I remembered and very comfortable. Primary use will be in my home studio and causal listening. There may be better out there but not for the money and my use. This is a design that hadn't changed in 40 years and no need to. Just great sound and comfort. Buy Them, Buy Them, Buy Them,,,,,,,,,,,,
customer_reviews.author: Richtx

customer_reviews.title: Good sound at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Good sounding headphones. They could probaby use an external amplifier, but my mixing got a little better when I switched to these from a closed-back design. Bass response is a little weak but that's to be expected using internal amps and open construction. They only took a couple of hours to "burn in" and sound was a little tinny and sharp prior to that. I was disappointed to find that the headphone end of the removable cable is a proprietary connector, I somehow got the impression that it was the standard 1/4" on both sides so that if the cable were damaged it would be easy to source a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: lindsey adams

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & great so unding
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones... I'll say off the bat, this is what I was looking for: 1) semi-closed, as to hear what's around me while listening to quiet music at work 2) comfortable 3) balanced leveling Overall this lived up to those expectations really well. I had ATHM50's before but they were a bit too snappy on my head, which caused headaches after a couple hours. These I can wear for upwards of five hours and feel totally fine. The bass and mids are great... couldn't have asked for a better headphone. Highly recommend it if you are seeking alternatives to ATHM50s
customer_reviews.author: Inazuma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the PC
customer_reviews.text: These babies give you high-end studio sound. I have an older Klipsch 4.1 Pro Media system and plug these into the headphone jack on the side of the front speaker control pod. They sound just as good as the Klipsch(without the booming bass) which is a very high compliment.
customer_reviews.author: MDWood1

customer_reviews.title: Not bass-heavy, but clear and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my on-ear Radio Shack headphones (which I thought sounded pretty good), these cans have a presence of space, while the on-ear's sound flat by comparison. After reading people's ratings about them being cheap, I didn't think they seemed cheap. They are comfortable and this is why I bought them... so I could wear them for extended periods. One reviewer sent them back because his cubemates could hear them. All I can say about that is that at normal listening levels, I could not hear the sound out of the back of the cans at about 30 inches. He must have had those cans turned up very loud to disturb his cubemates.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ericson

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have earbuds, and closed back but this open headphones providrd a clearer musi experience. This is my second pair the first one still works however several plastic peices have broke off.
customer_reviews.author: James Skiles

customer_reviews.title: Best budget mixing headphones
customer_reviews.text: For the price they are dollar for dollar worth it. I love the nearly flat response for mixing. For listening they are kind of boring due to nothing really being hyped like mids and bass but no worries because that’s what they are made to do. Definitely a great pair of Mixing headphones for checking and even full mixes when you cannot use monitors to mix on.
customer_reviews.author: soundguy937

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality-disappointing. Build quality-good.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the build seems to be good. However, the sound quality leaves much to be desired. Based off of the sound quality and range, these could be fakes. The low range is the worst I’ve heard and the treble is weak. That being said the mid range is good.
customer_reviews.author: Why pay more

customer_reviews.title: Great professional product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these AKG headphones for many years in a professional environment and these are the best! Semi open design lets your ears breathe so you can wear them for extended periods of time. Mixes translate well. They are not hyped like many others are and what you hear is what you get. The ear pads don't crumble like some others. Last four sets I bought lasted for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Shattuck

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying these headphones. While I'm not an expert or audiophile, I think they sound great. They are quite comfortable as well, the last pair I had my ears would start hurting from being pinched by my glasses and the headphones after half an hour or so, these don't at all even hours into gaming/listening to music when I should be sleeping. My only real qualm with the headphones is the cable, it's nice that it's removable, but I'm not that fond that it's a mini-xlr opposed to a standard 1⁄8" / 3.5mm plug that is far more common and cables are much easier to find.
customer_reviews.author: daigoji

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as I was hoping.
customer_reviews.text: For long listening/mixing sessions, the size and circular shape of the pads & density of the pad means they don't easily cover my ears and pinch on my glasses. Pad replacement with 3rd party pads was easy though, due again to the circular shape. These need a decent headphone amp.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable, great sound
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my project studio for tracking, and they're perfect for that. They're light and suitable for extended wear. The cable is long and comes with a screw-in adapter to switch between 1/8" stereo and 1/4" stereo. I've had zero problems with them. I enjoy wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to these from some passive noise isolating Sennheisers (aka fit snug on the ear) (which I liked as well, to provide you some reference on my taste). These are beautiful, full range headphones that do a great job in honestly reproducing music. (Also very comfortable) These really seemed to benefit from a headphone amp over the standard audio jack on a MBP and other random laptops. You can hear what is going on around you with these - call that a positive or negative as you see fit. I love these, and would argue that at the buck and a half price point, you can't do better.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Hustle and flow amiriteee???
customer_reviews.text: Great audio quality and bang for the buck when studio editing with monitors aren’t an option. Now, time to make some bangers nobody will probably ever hear of.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonS.

customer_reviews.title: WOW.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are simply amazing. I had a pair of Audio-Technica ATH-M50s and these are just as high quality as they are. I use the Audio-Technicas for taking with friends over Skype and such and these for listening to music. They both fill out their respective roles, perfectly. Plus, the ear cups (not the leather ones) are so soft and comfortable, and make the music bassier as well! I highly recommend these over anything else in this price point, include the Grados SR-80is.
customer_reviews.author: Diego V.

customer_reviews.title: USED FOR GAMING PS4 ,PS3
customer_reviews.text: WAIT!!! fellow gamers don't get too excited and buy it right away, you NEED TO HAVE A RECEIVER first, after reading about some decent headphones , this brand came up many times by other amazon members and i decided to try them, and yes they do need an amp to sound they way you expect for the price, or a receiver and then hooked to the PS3, PS4, Wii, XBOX one , whatever is your taste. what do i know about sound, nothing but here is the funny thing , even though they say stereo, i can hear the surround sound even better than sony wireless headset.
customer_reviews.author: comanche

customer_reviews.title: The best-sounding, most comfortable over-the-ear headphones in their price range
customer_reviews.text: I have used AKG K240 headphones in the recording studio and at home for more thank 35 years, and I love them. Are they the absolutely best-sounding headphones I have ever heard? No. But then, they don't cost $4000 either. If you are looking for a comfortable, over the ear headphone in this price range, I don't believe that you will find anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Son says they're great
customer_reviews.text: My son is a musician and asked me to buy these headphones for him. He loves them for his in studio recordings.
customer_reviews.author: phlew1120

customer_reviews.title: Best heads ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I play a keyboard and record in my studio. These give the most live action sound that can even match the custom surround speaker's I have . The bass is clear and tight not over exaggerated ,the 2 ear pad covers are a nice touch along with a 1/4 stereo jack adapter and 2 cords coiled and straight a mark of a truly class act Company and the AKG 240 MK ll head phones. I have had some very high end H/S on and these will stand tall beside any of them. Best of all For high-end quality verses price these will not break the bank ...
customer_reviews.author: Richard Koeder

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor headphones
customer_reviews.text: More comfortable than I thought. I use them as monitors for my Zoom Q8. You can still hear even though they are over the ear but not fully closed. Good crisp sound. Also glad I don't have to wear on the top of my head with the round design. Ear cup covers come with felt if you sweat with leather. Also comes with a telephone cord like cable if you don't need the long straight cable.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Quality Headphones at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: quality cans at a decent price. I have some Shure SRH 840's for my music room, which are superior, but are quite heavy, and I get head fatigue sometimes. I use these AKG's for long sessions where i still need an accurate mix. I am glad I picked them up. A little light on the bass, but enough in there to give me a good idea what is going on. I like em! I think you will too.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Kath

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with good sound
customer_reviews.text: Open back design makes for a very comfortable listening experience in addition to light frame and smaller drivers. The sound profile is as advertised and the included ear pads and coiled cable are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Sound plus comfort plus functionality
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones money can buy. They sound great and the kit they come with is a great value. I am currently using a DT770 PRO and the next Headphones I buy will be AKG K240 MKII or whatever the contemporary equivalent happens to be in the event of such occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: K A L

customer_reviews.title: Shut up and spend your money!
customer_reviews.text: Do you want a pair of headphones to accurately listen to your music? Do you enjoy hearing Everything in your music? Then yes this is a good buy. It is more an accurate sound producer than a bass thumper thingy. Comes with both leather and foam earpads, a really long cable and a short coiled cable. I use these for quiet listening and gaming at home (or sometimes just to show off.) Great pair of headphones!
customer_reviews.author: dorian

customer_reviews.title: Good for picture editing (reference)
customer_reviews.text: The AKG K 240MKIIs are good monitor headphones for basic Video editing or Podcasting. However, I'd stay clear of these if someone was a DJ, Musician, or a Sound Designer/Editor for film. The Good: Great Mids. Surprising in cans that are between $100-$200. Sounds better than the usual SONY MDR- 7510s They are comfortable. (I Have a Big Head) The Bad: Bad for playback, Music, ETC. (stuff requiring a larger dynamic range) Bulky headphones slide off of head if worn while walking. Ears get warm. Cord is Too Long
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Ramirez Jr

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good, but perhaps lacking in clarity compared to other brands
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great in a lot of ways (comfort, cable length, replacable cable, etc.), but I'm not so sure about certain asects of their sound. Specifically, they seem to lack the clarity and brightness compared to my new Sony MDR7506 headphones. Maybe the AKGs produce a more accurate sound, but maybe they're actually lacking clarity in the high end. To my ear at least, the Sonys sound a lot clearer and have better (more balanced, distinct) sound reproduction in the upper mid and high frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: M N Millar

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I have my old pair back
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of AKG headphones I bought in the 70's, and until they literally fell apart, I thought I'd never be able to match their sound. So I went with a pair of BOSE noise cancelling headphones and after a day or two realized they're not meant for true music listening. If you're using them with an I-Pod or something else, they do exactly what they say they do, you can't hear any outside noise. So, after perusing Amazon, i decided to go back to AKG. After a short "burn in" period, I feel like I have my old pair back!
customer_reviews.author: Bones 87FIS

customer_reviews.title: Great cans
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love these phones. I also have a pair of the Senn HD 555 and Grado SR 80i, but these, hands down, are my preferred phones. To my ears, they have the most neutral/transparent of the three. Music has become my evening meditation game; I listen carefully for the different instruments, placement of sounds, vibrato in voices, etc., and these reveal more than my other cans and to my ears sound the best. Very comfortable... my headphone shopping days are over.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wordlaw

customer_reviews.title: Simply, WOW
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of AKG semi open headphones in the early 80's that were awesome. This set, even though made in China, are even better than what I remember. Every sound broken out onto a very nice soundstage. Watched DVD of Pink Floyds -Pulse Concert with these babies on and cranked up the volume. Simply, WOW.............Wow, wow, wow. wow, wow.
customer_reviews.author: Prema1

customer_reviews.title: pares well with my amp
customer_reviews.text: great headphones, allows me to practice without keeping other people up. accurate sound
customer_reviews.author: Barry C

customer_reviews.title: Great for audiophiles!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are worth the price. I'm a fan of AKG headphones. I know there are a lot of headphone manufactures and the design may seem old school but I like the audio quality. I heard things I never heard before and the different ear pad and cord options are a plus. Yes I would buy these. They are great for any audiophile.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Horton III

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great and are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the most comfortable headphones I have ever worn. The sound on these are amazing. They do not sound like headphones at all. The only problem I have was that they are semi-open, and my work place has a lot of background noise. So, I ended up turning these up too high. I ended up with a pair of Beyerdynamics DT 770 Pro for work, which has much better sound isolation, but I like the sound of these better. Still, I'll wear these at home
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Comfortable Cans
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find good open-back headphones, with these features, at this price. The K240s have a very comfortable fit and seem to have a pretty neutral sound, when used for mixing. The MKII version adds value with the ability to swap out cords and the set of replacement ear pads. They are great for home recording on a budget. They strike me as the headphone equivalent of the Shure SM57 mic: a no frills industry standard for decades, for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have used AKG headphone for the last 30 years mixing and editing audio professionally. The 240 MK II are perfect. They are light, which is important if you're going to be wearing them for any length of time. The sound reproduction is top notch, and these thing are built to last. You can spend more, but there's no need to. If you're one of those people who've been using ear buds, do your hearing a favor, and invest in proper headphones like these.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stanley

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, non-fatiging, and suitable for anyone serious about audio
customer_reviews.text: Excellent studio headphones for the price. The headphones are well built and very comfortable. The overall sound is very clear, non-fatiguing, and suitible for writing/mastering tracks.The sound stage is heavier on the mids and treble and than the bass, so I use these in my studio mostly for vocals, guitar, synth, and any other sounds from about 100Hz and up on the spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: John Reiner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: 'Wow' doesn't do them justice. Music sounds airy and natural with well-balanced bass. I listen to a wide variety including Metallica, Enya, Classical and they all sound great. These cans are comfy, I can wear them for hours. I usually can't listen to music for more than 30 or so minutes before my ear fatigue, but with theses guys I can go long time. They come with two detachable cables, coiled and straight, and pleather and velux ear covers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Caveman

customer_reviews.title: But I have a pretty good ear and would definitely know if these sounded ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I don't know the first thing about headphones! But I have a pretty good ear and would definitely know if these sounded tinny or muddy or whatever; they don't. I have them hooked up to my Yamaha Baby Grand piano so that I can play without bothering others in the house, and the sound is really clear, really nice. I would definitely recommend them, esp for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lu A Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Best Money Spend
customer_reviews.text: IT delivers ALL what I was expecting for. I am a music composer and I do everything in my computer. These headphones are the ones I use for the final production stage (along with a few other that I need to bring about the proper sound). I think the money I invested in these ones are among the best I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Ceja

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Best earphones I've used at this price, and better than some I've tried in the past at twice or three times the cost. Mid and high frequencies are crisp and warm and the bass comes through beautifully without being overpowering. I use these for monitoring mixes when I'm away from the studio, so I'm not looking for frequency boosting. I got these over the original 240s because reviews said the velour ear pads were more comfortable. I definitely agree! They're much more breathable compared to other earphones I've used with leatherette pads. I wear these for hours and forget they're on. I highly recommend these earphones. Amazing sound and great price!
customer_reviews.author: babene

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding & Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Got these today and they sounded good right out of the box, and will only get better. Of course, I use them on a high-end headphone system but they sounded pretty good on my laptop too. As an bonus, they come with a cloth covered pair of ear cushions, which I am using because the vinyl makes my ears hot. Also comes with a coiled cable if that is preferred. For this money, I doubt one could do better.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: rock etc) I notice that the sound is too neutral and even boring. I guess this is what is expected from ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these primarily for my Yamaha p-155 piano and was not dissappointed: the sound of piano is airy, detailed and pleasant to the ear. When listening to music (vocal, pop, rock etc) I notice that the sound is too neutral and even boring. I guess this is what is expected from "Studio" headphones, as these are purchased for work, not for fun. So I have to say that listening to music in these is not a lot of fun, the sound is very truthful and rather plain (I use Creative EMU 0404 as a headphone amp). Would not recommend these for something that requires "bass".
customer_reviews.author: Igor Kurzin

customer_reviews.title: and i can easily say i haven't looked or thought about a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this headset for about 2 years now, and i can easily say i haven't looked or thought about a replacement. These are hands down the best pair of headphones I've ever owned. I recommended these to a friend, who now uses them and loves them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brodie

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Use them almost daily. From practicing on my bass guitar to movies on the laptop. They're super comfy, great sound, and durable!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Lingerfelt

customer_reviews.title: I love them for all applications
customer_reviews.text: I use these when recording and mixing my own music, as well as listening to Spotify, etc. I love them for all applications. They are extremely comfortable, sound great but somewhat neutral (i.e. no hyped bass and high end). At the price I think they are a great deal and wholeheartedly recommend them to anyone who wants to hear music in high quality without spending a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Teafortwo

customer_reviews.title: My AKG ROCKS🤘🏾🌟✌🏾
customer_reviews.text: I lile everything about it.. The Sound of course but the shape and the light weight... Game Changer for Sure. I’mbusing it to record my songs with Garage Band and my AKAI controller. Perfect Matching!!!! So Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric Boyer

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: lightweight and comfortable for long sessions. doesnt block room noise. sound is fine.
customer_reviews.author: NOYB3

customer_reviews.title: Still as good as many high-end phones!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, these are amazing! Even out of the box, they sound clear and have perfect balance from bass to treble. Both ear pad options are very comfy, and even though they are made of different material, it sounds the same with both. I bought an amp cause I thought I needed it, but you really don't since these are low impedance and sound great when directly connected into laptops, ipods, phones, etc. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for headphones, cause these are definitely more than worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: achelgeson

customer_reviews.title: Have loved AKG K240 for decades and still does not disappoint. My prior pair lasted 20 years.
customer_reviews.text: This model has been around forever. Newer and more expensive headphones do not sound any better than this. Definitely professional quality - you will not need to pay more for headphones. Terrific low end enhanced by being circumaural (surrounding the ear) topology. It is also handy to have conventional professional quarter inch jack as well as ability to plug into the ubiquitous 3.5 mm stereo jack on smart phones and other portionable devices. Very good for live recoding sessions as well as casual listening as long as you have air-conditioning.
customer_reviews.author: howard r. lieberman

customer_reviews.title: but this is horrible for ppl that need to hear midrange to mix
customer_reviews.text: wow these have no midrange at all...maybe its just this pair, but this is horrible for ppl that need to hear midrange to mix, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: can't beat AKG value proposition
customer_reviews.text: can't beat them, have used AKG for 20 years in home studio and casual listening. lightweight , reasonably durable, good value, would upgrade ONLY to another Pair of AKG"s
customer_reviews.author: The Java Master

customer_reviews.title: poor quality wiring in the jack
customer_reviews.text: quit working after 2 years due to a problem in the jack.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Best

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cans!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my professional recording studio while I listen to tracking at the board, and also as reference for mixing. They are equally good for general music listening and TV/game listening. They are also comfortable for extending wearing. They come with two sets of ear pads and a 1/4" adaptor. Would buy again. Amazon had the best price when you consider free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Earl R. Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Best I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: These are my first AKG headphones. I purchased after reading so many positive reviews. I love them. I use them at home since they are so large and comfortable. It seems like the louder I turn up the volume, the better they sound. I specifically purchased the semi-open design since I listen to a lot of acoustic music. They sound wonderful with jazz trios and classic music, but also sound like a surround sound system when I watch a move on Netflix. I've owned Sennheiser and Klipsch headphones, but these are more comfortable than either of them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Diaz

customer_reviews.title: amazing value.
customer_reviews.text: Classic, reliable, amazing value.. same as always.. Having to tolerate these days that -everything- ; even my boots, are now made in China.. no fighting it.. at least China is getting better and better at QA.
customer_reviews.author: E. C. Whittington

customer_reviews.title: The gold standard for studio monitors.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a headphone junkie, so I've looked at a lot of different models. If you're looking for a great pair of monitors you can wear for hours without much fatigue give these a try. I work in television post production so I will sometimes wear my cans for 8 hours a day. Very light. Great flat response. The semi-open deign makes them feel less stuffy to me. Everyone is different so be sure to find the right headphones for you but definitely check these out. These are my go to headphones on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Alder

customer_reviews.title: My ears like it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the MKII over the previous generation because of the extras that it came with: the coiled cord and the velour ear pads. I definitely think it's worth the extra $$ to get all of that cord out of my way and keep sweaty ear pads off my head (I use them at work at my desk). I'm pretty sure I need a better headphone amp, but I'm still reserving one star because these didn't totally blow me away.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'm a music producer and these headphones are amazing for mixing. Sub is great.. the range of frequencies that these headphones produce is unrivaled by any headphones I've used before. The quality of my tracks have improved greatly after I purchased these. Best investment in a long, long time. Great price too. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: Cable is a little flimsy. But besides that they are great. They come with replacement pads and a cord. Pricey but these are quality headphones.
customer_reviews.author: A D Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Nice cans
customer_reviews.text: Have used these daily for many years now, and they are still in great shape. Love the length of the cord, goes all the way around my desk with plenty of slack to Can wear these comfortably for 8+ hours, after that they may get slightly uncomfortable. My ears don't ever get hot wearing these, like they do with some other headphones I have used. Basically, they're great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very great sound quality. Only slight discomfort after extended wear - I believe this could be fixed by me switching the pads out to the extra set that was provided.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a pretty solid pick
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for audio quality at a reasonable price, this is a pretty solid pick. My only issue with the headphones was in the comfort department, though your results may vary. I wear glasses and have a bit of a big head and these headphones squeeze tight to my head which painfully presses the arms of my glasses into me. It is a shame that these headphones are such a discomfort to wear as the audio quality is so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these phones! I had some closed ear Sony's for years and while nice, don't compare with the AKG's. I worked in the LA recording scene for a few years quite awhile ago and we used K240 exclusively. Very rich sound with very little fatigue on the ears during long listening sessions. I use them as primary monitors while playing my drums and the open design helps me hear them and the mix nicely. The 2 cords offer a nice option as well. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gdyp

customer_reviews.title: Pure Pleasure!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item some time ago. If you need to wear headphones for any length of time, then you can't go wrong with these super light weight and super comfortable to wear phones. (Will not clamp down on your ears) The sound to full and rich when listening to Classical Music.
customer_reviews.author: William A

customer_reviews.title: True Headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: This headphones are simply great! If you are looking for something to record, this are a really good deal!!!!! They really sound like nothing, just like water! The speakers really reproduces the sounds very tight! Just as the Yamaha monitors series HS So, if you are looking just for regular headphones to listen to music, they are not going to sound good at all. This is not for listening music, this is for listening to details. This is just for listening every single frequency without adding something else. If you have a crappy record, here is going to sound worse! This is just for people how know what they are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing and recording.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality and good fat response. I use these for mixing and recording.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't afford the $300-$400 ones but I wanted something really good. These headphones were relatively inexpensive ~ I think
customer_reviews.text: Got these a year ago for my guy. I did a lot of research. I couldn't afford the $300-$400 ones but I wanted something really good. These headphones were relatively inexpensive ~ I think I paid about $125-$150 for them. Great sound, noise canceling. Fit is good and they are a very good fit. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: pgels

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive headphones. Comfortable fit and easy to adjust. Sound is great compared to my old ones.
customer_reviews.author: ORA

customer_reviews.title: ATH-AD700 replacement
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement for my broken ATH-AD700 but 1) not as comfortable and 2) less impressive sound-stage. Performs great and I love that it came two sets of cables (coiled and straight) and two sets of pads (fake leather and suede). The pads are a bit stiff in my opinion. I like the product but I would consider another brand next time around due to quality of ear pads alone.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and tight sounds
customer_reviews.text: These headphones put you in front of the musician when they were making the track. Bass isn't overwhelming (bass-heads look elsewhere) yet the instruments and the sounds there emitting are precise and don't bleed into other notes. These are great for watching movies as well. Overall quality feel, would have gone 5 stars if the bass slammed.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: Best Buy for the price also the most sensitive and accurate reference Headphone monitors I know of for this price. If you're on a budget you can mix with these without field monitors even!! (although the reason you need field monitors is you can't get accurate low end sound on headphones, you still can get a clue on these) If your into making music that is listened to thru headphones (internet,MP3's) these will help you mix better. They are also good for getting the details on your mixes and blending in effects without it sounding like you using effects. (which is how a pro is suppose to mix)
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as my $700 pair
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as my $700 pair, However the sound is much higher quality and comfort is good enough. Best phones for the $$ Hands down!!
customer_reviews.author: OregonTree

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for resolving detail
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for my old Senheiser 545 headphones, which were about 10 years old. I was really surprised at the resolution of treble detail without sounding harsh. Strings sound much better. I will also caveat this by saying that these phones show lower quality MP3 recordings in all their graininess, compression, etc. that my other phones tend to mask. Finally, be aware that these are not noise cancelling and that others will hear what you are listening to, as these are not closed - back.
customer_reviews.author: James Orr

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research looking for a comfortable set of headphones. I'm not super informed like many of the other reviewers but I know what is comfortable and what has good sound. These headphones have to be the most comfortable I have ever tried on. There's no adjusting prior to putting them on your head... they automatically adjust. Super smooth, really nice. I wear headphones almost all day at work and these AKG's are a treat to wear for long periods of time. The sound quality is excellent! At work, I listen mostly at low volume but on the train rides home I adjust the volume higher and the sound quality is amazing. Well worth the money...
customer_reviews.author: Jinscoe

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is EXCELLENT and I love having semi-open headphones. Great price and wonderful quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and great comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and great comfort. Really excellent midrange. Slightly lacking in low bass, but this can be mitigated with a preamp. These are very light. They are open style so other people will be able to hear you if you have them cranked. Overall the sound quality is great, very clear and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Brice E Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Bang for buck winner!
customer_reviews.text: You'd be hard pressed to find a better value at this price point. Competes with some of my 40mm and 50mm driver headphones in fidelity. Bass response is a little soft for bass & drum tracks, but perfect for my guitar monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound quality. Very crisp. These are not meant for blocking out noise but they are great for mixing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Freezy

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I work in a semi-open office so these are great for listening to music without bothering others as well as drowning noise out.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good headphones with good sound and good isolation from surroundings. They are a bit hot to wear but that's true of most headphones that cover the ear completely. Very sturdy, and the coiled cord helps a lot in avoiding tangles.
customer_reviews.author: EENoted

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome, nice true response. I can mix and play on other systems with confidence that it will translate.
customer_reviews.author: G.Versão

customer_reviews.title: The best cans out there
customer_reviews.text: The best cans out there. Been using AKGs in the broadcast studio for decade for a reason... They are simply the best sounding, most comfortable headphones on the market today. Expensive but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been mixing music for years and I can't believe it took me so long to find these. I've used everything from Sony's, to Samson, basically everything on the market and these are, by far, the best for the price. The headphones are FLAT which means your mix sounds exactly as it is supposed to sound without any coloration, for which I am truly grateful. I haven't had such a great sounding mix in a long time. I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and better! I was worried that these would not be ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised and better! I was worried that these would not be that good. These are pro gear and I am very proud!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Fairly good sound. The ear covers are rather large and tend to make your ears sweat a bit. And even though they completely cover your ears, these are still considered "open" headphones, so they do bleed whatever music you're listening to.... so yes, your wife, boyfriend, significant other, your dog or anyone within a foot or two of you will hear almost every note of every song you listen to. Bad news, they probably don't want to hear every note of every song you listen to. These also have a funky headphone cord with a weird connection.
customer_reviews.author: Mockingbird

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, excellent sound, very flat, are ideal for mastering vinyl rips, you will hear elements in the music that don't heard it before, if you use to listen the audio from movies with this headphones is like be in the cinema, i love AKG.
customer_reviews.author: Ramiro

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: AKG headphones are musical, comfortable and K240 mk II is a rather good value right now. Thanks AKG/Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Lfa1

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, not for leisure
customer_reviews.text: The quality on these headphones is pretty good. Check out the parameters given in the product description. Now that I look back I wish that I had bought some closed phones. These are semi-open, which I had never seen before, so I thought that I'd test em out. While the semi-openness creates a great listening environment, it leaves room for a large amount of sound leakage. I was planning on using these for work and leisure, but I don't like feeling like I am disturbing others with music when I take them out of a personal setting.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Koroluk

product_meta.title: AKG K 240 MK II Stereo Studio Headphones
product_meta.description: The AKG K240 MKII professional over-ear, semi-open headphones carry on the success of their predecessor—the AKG K240 Studio—and are a standard in studios, orchestras and on stages around the world. Their advanced 30 mm XXL transducers with patented Varimotion diaphragms deliver a wide dynamic range, increased sensitivity and high sound levels, while their semi-open design provides the airiness of open headphones with the powerful bass response of closed designs. With impressive accuracy, musicians, producers and engineers rely on the AKG K240 MKII to clearly hear mixing details, which has made these headphones a standard in recording settings. In addition to great sound quality, the headphones are extremely durable and comfortable. Not only built to withstand the demands of countless hours in the studio, their self-adjusting headband provides an ideal fit and their over-ear pads nicely envelop the ears. The AKG K240 MKII headphones also feature a professional mini XLR connector and come with a 3m (10ft) straight cable, 5m (16ft) coiled cable and convertible jack plug for connecting portable equipment easily. Altogether, from performance and ease of use to comfort and reliability, the AKG K240 MKII is a powerful tool for production environments.
feature_bullets: Over-ear designfor comfort during long work sessions
Semi-open technologyfor solid bass and airy highs
Patented Varimotion 30 mm XXL transducerfor accurate signal transfer and great dynamic range
The choice of professionals around the worldstage and studio standard for more than two decades
